page.title: 12HOME-LIFE KIRKBY MALZEARD
page.content: Old & new stand together in our villages. There is great respect for family life & strong community spirit Some folk entertain at home perhaps experimenting with exotic foods others prefer traditional plain cooking. Most have gardens with vegetables & fruit. Mushrooms & wild fruit are used. Jam making & freezing garden produce is extensive. Most cakes & biscuits are home made & home baked bread is quite common.We have a doorstep delivery of green top unpasteurised milk (1985). {Drinks,}mainly tea & coffee.{Meat}from local butchers.{Groceries}from village shops or Ripon supermarkets.{Fuel,}no gas so electricity, solid fuel or oil. Open fires in all homes. Also central heating in newer houses.{Kitchens, mainly electric cookers.Microwave ovens becoming popular.Freezers, fridges & automatic washers are common
